Appleove 5G iPhone naj bi poganjali prvi 5-nanometrski čipi

04 Nov 2019, 11:50


Od prihodnjega leta bodo kar trije Appleovi telefoni, ki bodo omogočali tehnologijo 5G, tekli na Qualcommovem X55 5G modemu, poročajo pri novičarskem portalu Nikkei.

Modem naj bi deloval vzporedno s setom Appleovih čipov (poimenovali naj bi ga z zvenečim imenom A14 Bionic), kar bi Appleu zagotovilo prvo mesto med podjetji, ki v izdelke vgrajuje 5-nanometrske procese. V splošnem so takšni čipi učinkovitejši, hkrati pa omogočajo boljše in zmogljivejše procesiranje v manjšem prostoru. 
Omenjene govorice, da Apple načrtuje izdajo svojih prvih 5G telefonov že leta 2020, nismo slišali prvič, niti tega, da kani prodajati kar tri nove modele obenem. Appleov analitik Ming-Chi Kuo je podobno napoved podal že julija letos. Kar je novo, so poročila o točno določenem Qualcommovem modemu, ki ga Apple namerava uporabiti, potem ko sta podjetji aprila rešili nek pravni spor. Dolgoročno naj bi Apple izdeloval popolnoma svoje modeme, saj so v podjetju letošnjega julija kupili tudi večino Intelovega znanja o modemih za pametne telefone.
Poročilo prav tako potrjuje predhodne govorice, da se je Apple osredotočil na 5 nm procese v čipih in njihovo uresničitev že prihodnje leto, kar pomeni, da se odmika od čipov tipa 7 nm v procesih, ki so v uporabi od lanskega leta. Tekmec Huawei naj bi prav tako delal na uvedbi boljših tehnologij čipov, kar še dodatno pritiska na časovnico ameriškega tehnološkega giganta.
Poleg 5G tehnologije in izboljšanih čipov naj bi bili iPhonei, ki jih bo Apple lansiral prihodnje leto, osveženi predvsem z oblikovnega vidika. Senzor za zaznavo prstnega odtisa naj bi imeli kar v zaslonu samem, polag treh klasičnih modelov pametnih telefonov pa si uporabniki lahko obetajo tudi cenejšo različico, podobno modelu iPhone SE.

Apple's 5G iPhones are expected to be powered by the first 5nm chips

04 Nov 2019, 11:50


As of next year, as many as three Apple 5G-enabled phones will be running on Qualcomm's X55 5G modem, according to the Nikkei news portal.

The modem is expected to work side-by-side with a set of Apple chips (known as the A14 Bionic), giving Apple the first place among companies to integrate 5nm processes into products. In general, such chips are more efficient, while allowing for better and more efficient processing in a smaller space.
The rumors that Apple is planning to release its first 5G phones in 2020, we did not hear for the first time, nor that it plans to sell as many as three new models at the same time. Apple analyst Ming-Chi Kuo made a similar announcement in July this year. What's new is reports of a specific Qualcomm modem that Apple plans to use after the two companies settled a legal dispute in April. In the long run, Apple is expected to make entirely its modems, since the company also purchased most of Intel's knowledge of smartphone modems this July.
The report also confirms previous rumors that Apple has focused on 5nm processes in chips and their implementation next year, which means it is moving away from 7nm chips in processes in use since last year. The Huawei competitor is also set to work on the introduction of better chip technologies, which puts further pressure on the timeline of the US tech giant.
In addition to 5G technology and improved chips, the iPhones that Apple will launch next year are expected to be refreshed primarily from a design standpoint. The fingerprint sensor is supposed to be on the screen itself, and with the installation of three classic smartphone models, users can also expect a cheaper version similar to the iPhone SE.
